result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony Edward Pearson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Firearm by Felon, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2).
  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Fine is set at ZERO.
Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance upon release shall be due by 08-01-2018; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment.
Concurrent with: concurrent with count 1 in 15CF818 and count 3 in 15CF1173 but consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 150 days (3-13-2015 to 08-10-2015) time served.

superMiscConds.notes:
No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor. 
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Court recommends case assigned to Mental Health Unit and Mental Health Evaluation and any recommended treatment. 
Court suggests Trauma Informed Mental Health Treatment.

No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.

Provide a DNA sample, if not already done.
Defendant to notify Department of Corrections agent of all prescriptions within 72 hours of receiving prescription from medical professional.
Fill all prescriptions at one pharmacy, unless otherwise approved by Department of Corrections Agent, and notify the Department of Corrections agent of the pharmacy used. 
Court ordered Defendant to comply with all child support court orders.

Maintain Absolute Sobriety.
Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.  
Department of Corrections must conduct drug and alcohol testing.

supervisions.notes: Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance upon release shall be due by 08-01-2018; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment. Fine set at Zero.
Concurrent with: concurrent with count 1 in 15CF818 and count 1 in 15CF1173 but consecutive to any other sentence; straight time; with credit for 150 days (3-13-2015 to 08-10-2015) time served.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony Edward Pearson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original SENTENCING  Transcript (35 pages) commencing AUGUST 10, 2015 received and filed. kl

Defendant Anthony Edward Pearson in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Defendant Anthony Edward Pearson in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1 -
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 7 YEARS, concurrent with count 1 in 15CF818 and count 3 in 15CF1173 but consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 150 days (3-13-2015 to 08-10-2015) time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is  4 YEARS.  

Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. 

- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
- Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance upon release shall be due by 08-01-2018; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment.

AS TO COUNT 3 -
Court ordered defendant to serve 9 MONTHS of incarceration, concurrent with count 1 in 15CF818 and count 1 in 15CF1173 but consecutive to any other sentence; straight time; with credit for 150 days (3-13-2015 to 08-10-2015) time served. 

- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
- Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance upon release shall be due by 08-01-2018; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety: No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.  
- Department of Corrections must conduct drug and alcohol testing.
- Defendant to notify Department of Corrections agent of all prescriptions within 72 hours of receiving prescription from medical professional.
- Fill all prescriptions at one pharmacy, unless otherwise approved by Department of Corrections Agent, and notify the Department of Corrections agent of the pharmacy used. 
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor. 
- Seek/Maintain fulltime employment. 
- Court ordered Defendant to comply with all child support court orders.
- Court recommends case assigned to Mental Health Unit and Mental Health Evaluation and any recommended treatment. 
- Court suggests Trauma Informed Mental Health Treatment. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Attorney Bridget Joy Krause in court, defendant Anthony Edward Pearson not in court, in custody, in the bull pen.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Held off the record. Case set for sentencing hearing. Defense counsel requested a brief adjournment for reasons presented to the Court. Case adjourned for sentencing hearing on 08-10-2015 at 8:30 am, branch 17.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
SENTENCING MEMORADNDUM AND COURT REPORT. FILED BY CSS YULONDA ANDERSON. kl

Defendant Anthony Edward Pearson in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Defendant Anthony Edward Pearson in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Case set for final pretrial. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. Case proceeded to plea hearing.

AS TO COUNT 1 and 3 : 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

AS TO COUNT 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed and read-in to case 
for the purposes of sentencing.

Court ordered the defendant REMANDED into custody pending sentencing. Court vacted Jury Trial on 08-05-2015. Case adjourned for sentencing, Branch 17.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Bridget Joy Krause in court, defendant Anthony Edward Pearson not in court, in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Held off the record. Case set for plea and sentencing. Parties have not reached a resolution in this matter.  For reasons presented to the Court defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial and Jury Trial. Any motions to be filed by 06-08-2015. Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order, signed and filed.  Copies given to state and defense counsel.  Case is adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference and Jury Trial scheduled, Branch 17.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 09:00 am.  Calendar call scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 05:00 pm.

Defendant Anthony Edward Pearson in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Defendant Anthony Edward Pearson in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for Plea and Sentencing. For the reason presented to the court the Defense WITHDRAWS the Demand for Speedy Trial. Upon questioning the Defendant, the Court notes that the Demand for Speedy Trial is withdrawn. Case is adjourned for Plea and Sentencing on 6-1-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.

Defendant Anthony Edward Pearson in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Defendant Anthony Edward Pearson in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Case set for plea and sentencing. For reasons placed on the record court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anthony Edward Pearson in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Defendant Anthony Edward Pearson in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.   
Defense counsel received discovery and offer.  Court orders case for adjourned Projected Plea and Sentencing on 4-21-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anthony Edward Pearson in court with attorney Nathan Opland Dobs for Bridget Joy Krause.  Defendant Anthony Edward Pearson in custody.  Dennis Murphy for Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
NO DA FILE IN COURT.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17 per Assignment of Assistant District Attorney and defendant lower pending case.  Arraignment scheduled for March 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Stefani H

Defendant Anthony Edward Pearson in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Anthony Edward Pearson in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Count 3.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
